snippet: A former United States serviceman, Amir Mirzaei Hekmati, has become the first American to receive a death sentence in Iran since the Islamic Revolution more than 30 years ago.
abstract: Iranian court imposes the death sentence on imprisoned American Amir Mirzaei Hekmati, a former Marine who was convicted on charges of spying for the Central Intelligence Agency; sentence is likely to become a new point of contention, and possible bargaining leverage, in Iran's struggle with the West over its nuclear program.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HARVEY MORRIS
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Harvey Morris from London. Reporting was contributed by William J. Broad from New York, Artin Afkhami from Boston, Steven Yaccino from Chicago, and Scott Shane from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A former United States serviceman, Amir Mirzaei Hekmati, has become the first American to receive a death sentence in Iran since the Islamic Revolution more than 30 years ago.

headline.seo: Iran Imposes Death Sentence in U.S. Spy Case
headline.main: Iran Imposes Death Sentence on U.S. Man Accused of Spying
headline.print_headline: Iran Sentences America to Die On Spy Charges
